legislature. In our example, the purpose of the
statute was obviously to provide a healthy environment for mammals in zoos.
This purpose is best served by interpreting the ordinance so that it does not re-
quire dry cages for whales.
In addition to words, intentions, and purposes, moral beliefsare often used
to interpret statutes. Judges often argue that a statute should be interpreted
one way by claiming that any other interpretation would lead to some kind
of  practical  difficulty  or  moral
